sentence.text: Several known breast cancer susceptibility genes encode proteins involved in DNA cellular protein catabolic process response (DDR) and are characterized by rare loss-of-function mutations.
c.7253dupT in DNA repair, encoding a DDR factor important in meiosis, associated with hereditary breast cancer (p = 0.018) and likely represents a Northern Finnish founder mutation.
A deletion (c.640_644del5) in double-strand break repair, causative for recessive RIDDLE syndrome, had high prevalence in majority of the analyzed cohorts, but did not associate with breast cancer.
In conclusion, truncating variants in DNA repair and response to gamma radiation are potential breast cancer risk factors, warranting further investigations in other populations.
